chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Orioles are lazy birds who would prefer to be lounging around the greenhouse than out hunting.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " bird " to " Rong ", it means that the feathers of birds have the appearance of text. "Shuowen": "Birds. From the birds, the sound of Rongsheng. "The Poem" says: There are warblers and their feathers." "Poetry‧ Xiaoya‧ Sanghu": "If you cross the sanghu, there are warblers and their feathers." : "Yingran has an article."

" Warbler " is also used as the bird's name to mean yellow warbler, also known as oriole, Cang Geng, etc., and later refers to birds of the Oriodidae family. "Qin Jing": "Cang Geng, Mu Huang, and Yellow Birds" Jin Zhanghua's Note: "The Orioles and Orioles are the same now." Liang Qiuchi of the Southern Dynasties (Book with Chen Bo): "The late spring in March, the grass grows in Jiangnan , Peanut tree, swarms of warblers flying randomly."
humanum_short_description_en: From " bird " to " Rong ", it means that bird feathers have the appearance of text.
humanum_full_description:
從「鳥」，「榮」省聲，表示鳥類羽毛有文彩之貌。《說文》：「鳥也。从鳥，榮省聲。《詩》曰：有鶯其羽。」《詩‧小雅‧桑扈》：「交交桑扈，有鶯其羽。」毛傳：「鶯然有文章。」

　　「鶯」也用作鳥名，表示黃鶯，又稱黃鸝、倉庚等，後泛指鳥綱鶯科鳥類。《禽經》：「倉庚、黧黃，黃鳥也」晉張華注：「今謂之黃鶯、黃鸝是也。」南朝梁丘遲〈與陳伯之書〉：「暮春三月，江南草長，雜花生樹，群鶯亂飛。」
humanum_short_description: 從「鳥」，「榮」省聲，表示鳥類羽毛有文彩之貌。

從「 鳥 」，「 榮 」省聲，表示鳥類羽毛有文彩之貌。《說文》：「鳥也。从鳥，榮省聲。《詩》曰：有鶯其羽。」《詩‧小雅‧桑扈》：「交交桑扈，有鶯其羽。」毛傳：「鶯然有文章。」 「 鶯 」也用作鳥名，表示黃鶯，又稱黃鸝、倉庚等，後泛指鳥綱鶯科鳥類。《禽經》：「倉庚、黧黃，黃鳥也」晉張華注：「今謂之黃鶯、黃鸝是也。」南朝梁丘遲〈與陳伯之書〉：「暮春三月，江南草長，雜花生樹，群鶯亂飛。」
From " bird" to " Rong", it means that the feathers of birds have the appearance of text. "Shuowen": "Birds. From the birds, the sound of Rongsheng. "The Poem" says: There are warblers and their feathers." "Poetry‧ Xiaoya‧ Sanghu": "If you cross the sanghu, there are warblers and their feathers." : "Yingran has an article." " Warbler" is also used as the bird's name to mean yellow warbler, also known as oriole, Cang Geng, etc., and later refers to birds of the Oriodidae family. "Qin Jing": "Cang Geng, Mu Huang, and Yellow Birds" Jin Zhanghua's Note: "The Orioles and Orioles are the same now." 鶯字的基本解释

鶯
yīng
见“莺”。

鶯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīng］
［《廣韻》烏莖切，平耕，影。］
“莺1”的繁体字。亦作“鸎1”。
(1)鸟羽有文彩貌。
(2)黄莺。又称黄鹂、仓庚等。
(3)鸟纲莺科鸟类的通称。种类较多。体型大多较麻雀为小，羽毛多绿褐色、灰褐色。主食昆虫，为农林益鸟。

鶯字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鶯； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页1496第05
【唐韻】烏莖切【集韻】於莖切【韻會】幺莖切，?音罌。【說文】鶯，鳥也。卽黃鸝。一名倉庚，一名商倉，一名鵹黃，一名鸝鶹，一名鸝鶬，一名楚雀，一名黃袍，一名搏黍，一名黃鳥，一名金衣公子。魏文帝王粲?有鶯賦。又鳥羽文。【詩·小雅】交交桑扈，有鶯其羽。【毛傳】鶯然有文章也。俗作鸎，非。

鶯字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鶯字的起名意思

暂无。

warbler
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yīng］
["Guangyun" black stems are cut, ploughed, and shadowed. ]
Traditional characters for "鶯1". Also known as "鸎1".
(1) Toba has a literary appearance.
(2) Yellow warbler. Also known as Oriole, Cang Geng and so on.
(3) The general term for birds of the Ornididae. There are many kinds. Most of them are smaller than sparrows, and their feathers are greenish brown and grayish brown. Staple food insects, for agriculture and forestry beneficial birds.
warbler
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　ying; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Page Number: Page 1496 No. 05
[Tang Yun] Wu Stem Cut [Ji Yun] Cut at the stem [Yun Hui] Cut the single stem, and the sound pops. [Said the text] warbler, the bird too. Oriole. One Cang Geng, one Shang Cang, one Huang, one oriole, one oriole, one Chu bird, one yellow robe, one wrestling, one yellow bird, and one golden boy. Emperor Weiwen Can? Has Ying Fu. Again Toba text. [Poetry·Xiaoya] Crossing Sanghu, there are Yingqiyu. [Mao Chuan] Yingran has articles. Commonly used as a horseman, non.
